text:
Question for my upcoming blog -
I am compiling some of the best email newsletters across all different industries with an analysis of what makes each one great and tips on how readers can emulate them. Tell me which brand's newsletters you love and why. I will add your quotes as a thank you. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text:
Question for my upcoming blog -
I am compiling some of the best email newsletters across all different industries with an analysis of what makes each one great and tips on how readers can emulate them. Tell me which brand's newsletters you love and why. I will add your quotes as a thank you.

text: One of my favs this year has been Morning Brew. It has this sneaky low key, simplicity to it  and throws in plenty of video content (including meme's!) that don't feel forced or out of place. Its one of those rare newsletters that I will actually go searching for to seek out if I miss it in the inbox.  Uniquely its also one of those newsletter that's provides enough content in the email I don't need to go clicking through everyday to the main site so they are Newsletter first rather than all about them clicks.

elements.text: One of my favs this year has been Morning Brew. It has this sneaky low key, simplicity to it  and throws in plenty of video content (including meme's!) that don't feel forced or out of place. Its one of those rare newsletters that I will actually go searching for to seek out if I miss it in the inbox.  Uniquely its also one of those newsletter that's provides enough content in the email I don't need to go clicking through everyday to the main site so they are Newsletter first rather than all about them clicks.

text:
Aside from the aforementioned Morning Brew, I love the <http://Chorus.fm|Chorus.fm> <https://chorus.fm/news/weekly-newsletter/|newsletter>. It's a perfect combo of music, pop culture, tech, and life from my favorite music community website.

The Chorus newsletter works because Jason _*knows*_ his audience, which is the real secret to making any newsletter successful. This newsletter comes out once a week, but it's only one I make the effort to open the day it gets sent out. It includes latest music releases, movie recommendations, tech tips, and  top 10 songs for the week.

attachments.title: Weekly Newsletter
attachments.text: Subscribe to our weekly newsletter full of music and entertainment news and commentary. It’s out every Friday.

text: Does anyone use/know of any great SaaS link builders for content specifically? (So building links directly to a blog post) I'm looking to do a roundup of case studies on excellent link building to a specific blog post and would love some recs. Or if you have a post and have built links to it in-house, I'd be interested. Thanks!

text:
I think my feeling here is that you don’t have to take a single approach.

For example, a post about the company taking a new direction definitely needs to be bylined by the CEO. But a post explaining a specific topic or presenting a list of some kind might come from the editorial team. It could even change over time, coming from the author on publish and the editorial team when they leave.

Also, bylines can be a helpful tool for encouraging contributions, especially if the author information and blurb are included at the end of the post (instead of in a separate /author/ page).

<@UJJFDTN8G> I’m very curious to see the blog post on this if you end up writing one!

elements.text:
I think my feeling here is that you don’t have to take a single approach.

For example, a post about the company taking a new direction definitely needs to be bylined by the CEO. But a post explaining a specific topic or presenting a list of some kind might come from the editorial team. It could even change over time, coming from the author on publish and the editorial team when they leave.

Also, bylines can be a helpful tool for encouraging contributions, especially if the author information and blurb are included at the end of the post (instead of in a separate /author/ page).
I’m very curious to see the blog post on this if you end up writing one!
